availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Bullet (Switzerland County, Indiana, sculptor and marble dealer)

body.p: Switzerland County, Indiana, sculptor and marble dealer. Native of France. Married to Matilda Salve Bullett in Hamilton County, Ohio, on October 8, 1859. Father of Charles Bullett and Robert Bullett. Immigrated to the United States on September 13, 1856. Sculptor in Switzerland County, Indiana, in 1860. Marple dealer in partnership with Michael Muldoon, Charles Bullett, and John Walton in Muldoon, Bullett, & Company, in Louisville in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Switzerland County, Jefferson, p. 311.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Bellevue, p. 231A.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Hamilton County Marriages, Film 000344480.
New York, U.S. Arriving Passenger and Crew Lists, 1820-1957, Passenger Arrival Lists (1817-1897), NARA Series M237, RG 85, Ship Helvetia, 1856.
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1866), 231, 453.
"Charles Ferreal Auguste Bullett (1820-1873)," Find A Grave, Memorial 103259533 , accessed June 30, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/103259533 .
